content:
Nick Nisi joins us to dig into the latest trends from this year and how they're impacting his day-to-day coding and Vision Pro wearing. Anthropic's acquisition of Bun, the evolving JavaScript and AI landscape, GitHub's challenges and the AMP/Sourcegraph split. They dive into AI development practices, context management, voice assistants, Home Assistant OS and home automation, the state of the AI browser war, and we close with a prediction from Nick. :link: https://changelog.am/120

What tiling Window Manager for Mac are you using, @Nick Nisi? :eyes:
Yep, Aerospace is amazing! Honestly can’t Mac without it anymore. I’ve been using it for almost 2 years

image.png
Jerod grew a lot of hair. o_o

I wrote up about this appearance and included links to some of the plugins and agents I’m building and using

https://nicknisi.com/posts/very-important-agents/
I couldn't grow that much hair if I wanted to @Owen Valentine :stuck_out_tongue_wink:

Nick Nisi said:

Yep, Aerospace is amazing! Honestly can’t Mac without it anymore. I’ve been using it for almost 2 years

I agree 100%. I've been using it since the day it was in alpha stage and the author has done an amazing job at finally cracking the tiling window problem for Mac. It's the first thing I install on any Mac system. The defaults are quite sane; I barely have tinkered with the config file.
Hey everyone, I am looking for a U.S. citizen developer for business collaboration. Please contact me if you are interested.

Firefox is becoming an ai browser. Here we go…

https://blog.mozilla.org/en/mozilla/leadership/mozillas-next-chapter-anthony-enzor-demeo-new-ceo/
